titleproper.value: Guide to the Bob Witz Papers, circa early 1960s-2010 <num>MSS.080</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Daniel Sokolow in 1997. Updated in 2012 by Laura Newsome.

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2017-12-01T20:39:32</date>

extent.value: in 6 record cartons, 2 flat boxes, 2 manuscript boxes, 7 oversize folders

abstract.value: Bob Witz is the editor of <emph render="italic">Appearances Magazine</emph>, a small arts magazine first published in the East Village during the 1980s. Witz is also an artist, writer and sculptor who lives in New York. The collection consists of material related to <emph render="italic">Appearances Magazine</emph>, correspondence, gallery catalogues and ephemera, sketchbooks, writings, chap books, drawings, and photographs.

p.value: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Bob Witz Papers/Appearances Magazine; MSS 080; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

The Bob Witz Papers were donated to the Fales Library by Mr. Witz in the Fall of 1996. The accession number associated with the original donation is 1996.080. Multiple accretions to the collection were donated between 1997 and circa 2010. The accession numbers associated with these accretions are: 2001.080, 2006.080, 2009.080, 2014.080, 2015.080, 2017.049, 2017.050, 2017.051, 2017.052, 2017.053.

Bob Witz is a painter/sculptor, writer, poet, and editor of <emph render="italic">Appearances Magazine</emph>. <emph render="italic">Appearances</emph> is a small, low-budget magazine which was started in the East Village and has been published from the 1980s to the present. It is devoted mostly to the art scene with a focus on the alternative currents of this scene. Witz also published/produced small chapbooks, including an early book by Keith Haring, and <emph render="italic">Leaves of Grass II: a book/by Bob Witz</emph> (1972). Witz, along other writers represented in the Downtown collection (Ron Kolm and Tom Savage, 1948- ), is also closely associated with the Unbearables literary group.

The collection includes both professional and personal correspondence. Among the correspondence are numerous exhibition announcements from various galleries around New York City and elsewhere. In addition to gallery ephemera there are also some exhibition catalogs from various galleries.

subject.value: Avant-garde (Aesthetics) -- United States -- History -- 20th century -- Periodicals.
Small presses -- New York (State) -- New York.

dsc.value:
Series I: AppearancesScope and Contents note

The series consists primarily of notebooks compiled by Witz over his years as publisher of the magazine. Included within the notebooks are poems, drawings, phone numbers, and other assorted items. Also included in the series are financial documents and artwork from the magazine, as well as notebooks from before the beginning of the magazine.

This accretion contains Bob Witz's sketchbooks (1974-1997), Stencil Novel (1978-1980), chapbooks (undated), submissions to Appearances Magazine, photographs, correspondence (1983-1997), newspapers (1970-1972), catalogues and ephemera from galleries (1983-1997). The accretion includes notes and writings by Bobby Joe Burbridge (late 1960s - early 1970s), and writing by Julie Gross.

This accretion contains a copy of Paul Lamarre's EIDIA Manifesto printed on a napkin, Appearances Magazine correspondence, including catalogues and gallery ephemera (1986-2005), and personal correspondence (1988-1990).

Levy and Julie Gross; Gallery Catalogues and Ephemeralate 1960s-20084Sketchbooks, Photographs, Gallery Catalogues, Stencil Novel 1-4, and Beriah Wall Clay Tokens1977-20075Drawings, Correspondence, and Printed Ephemera1981-1989Fales OS 310SketchbookundatedFales OS 311Sketches and Printed Ephemera1960-75, 1997bulkFales OS 312Series VIII: Undated Accretion(s)1977-2010Scope and Contents

This accretion contains professional and personal correspondence (1977-2008), gallery catalogues and ephemera (1977-2008), submissions of writing and photographs to Appearances Magazine (undated, 1982, 1999, 2002-2010) and some Appearances production files, Appearances Press publications (1981-1986), a typescript of Don't Wait; Or, Wait, a novel by Robert Witz (undated), Bob Witz's sketchbooks (undated, 1990-2013) and some business records (circa 1980-1986) including Appearances certificate of incorporation (1983) and a list of subscribers (undated). There are also seven small flat round objects (1980s).
